Key Match Events: Rodrygo scored the only goal in the 29th minute after his effort deflected off a defender and hit the right post before finding the back of the net.
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil had another lacklustre performance, dominating possession but failing to create clear chances throughout the match.
Ecuador applied a physically aggressive pressure high with three hardworking forwards, making the locals uncomfortable when putting the ball in play.
Post-Match Reflections: Rodrygo told Brazilian TV Globo that he was happy with the victory and hoped it would help the team progress to the level they want to reach.
Brazil will face Paraguay at Asuncion on Tuesday while Ecuador is set to host Peru in Quito on Monday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil almost no room to get inside their box either, forcing them to roam the ball horizontally around their penalty area and resort to strikes from long range.
Ecuador almost levelled in a counterattack right before the break, but defender Gabriel Magalhães denied Moisés Caicedo's effort with a last-minute goal-line clearance.
